SURGICAL PATHOLOGY REPORT

NAME: BREAU, JOHN A. SURG PATH #: S24-5896 MR #: 8240512 SPECIMEN CLASS:
SR BILLING #: 1105500628 ALT ID #:  LOCATION: ASCMWOR DATE OF PROCEDURE:
2/12/2024 AGE:  52 SEX: M DATE RECEIVED: 2/13/2024 DOB: 12/20/1971  TIME
RECEIVED:  07:09 PHYSICIAN: REZA HEJAZI, MD DATE OF REPORT: 2/14/2024 COPY
TO:  DATE OF PRINTING: 2/14/2024 



########################################################################
Final Diagnosis:

A. Gastric mucosa, "gastric biopsy r/o h pylori", biopsy:
Focal minimal chronic inflammation.
No H. pylori-like organisms are identified on H and E sections.  

B. Squamous and gastric mucosa, "lower esophageal biopsy r/o Barrett's",
biopsy:
Moderate acute and chronic inflammation of gastric mucosa.    
Reactive changes of squamous mucosa; negative for intestinal metaplasia.  
 
C. Gastric mucosa, "gastric polyp", biopsy:
Fundic gland polyp.


Attestation:
By this signature, I attest that I have personally formulated the final
interpretation expressed in this report and that the above diagnosis is
based upon my examination of the slides and/or other material indicated in
this report.

+++Electronically Signed Out By Wei Cui, MD on 2/14/2024+++
         
ksw/2/14/2024
       

########################################################################
Material Received:
A: gastric biopsy r/o h pylori
B: lower esophageal biopsy r/o Barrett's
C: gastric polyp

History:
Gastroesophageal reflux disease with esophagitis without hemorrhage



Gross Description:
A. Received in formalin labeled "gastric biopsy rule out H. pylori" is a
0.4 x 0.3 x 0.2 cm aggregate of tan-brown soft tissue fragments. The
specimen is entirely submitted in A1.  (tn)

B. Received in formalin labeled "lower esophageal biopsy rule out
Barrett's" is a 0.4 x 0.2 x 0.2 cm aggregate of tan-brown soft tissue
fragments. The specimen is entirely submitted in B1.  (tn)

C. Received in formalin labeled "gastric polyp" is a large tan-brown
irregular shaped smooth polyp measuring 1.3 x 1.2 x 0.9 cm.  The resection
margin is inked black, the specimen is trisected and entirely submitted in
C1.  (tn)

tan/2/13/2024
